Hey guys it's JT here from Bullproof for BJJ. Now one of our guys JP has been
having some neck trouble. So we've got three really easy moves if you be able
to strengthen your neck and improve your posture. So first of all we're just
going to start with some chin tucks. So what I'm going to do is just cross my
hands across my collarbone, drawing down and from here I'm going to bring my
head forward into an unhealthy posture then I'm going to tuck my chin. Now I'm
not dropping my chin. I am pulling my chin directly back. Just like that. Head
forward, chin directly back. Now you may get a little bit of a stretch up to the
back of your neck down and that's okay. So chin forward, drawing directly back.
And once you guys to do ten repetitions of that, keeping collarbone down.
Because I don't want you guys to lift your chest up and lean. Keep
posture nice and straight and retract your chin. Okay, level two. Let's add a
little bit of load. So we're going to bring ourselves down to a plank position.
And just from this position guys I'm going to let my head drop squarely and then
I'm drawing my chin back. Bring my face down. Now I don't want you to tip your
head down. Don't look at your feet. Stay looking forward. Chin down, chin back.
This is going to be just a little bit more challenging through your traps and
up a neck. But that's okay. We're in it for the challenge. And I want you to stay
square through your shoulders. Drawing the back of your head up towards the
roof. Now level three is we're going to add some resistance. Here I have the
humble booty band. So what I'm going to do guys is I'm actually going to bring
this just over my wrist almost like it was handcuffs. Making a little bit of
space. And then I'm going to place just one part of the length of the band
just behind the back of my skull where my neck begins. So from here going back
to that same position, hands apart, plank up, holding this, allowing it to pull my
head down towards the ground and then drawing it up and back. Head down up and
back. Like I said before, don't allow it to pull your chin down. We want our
whole face to move down and then drawing up and back. And we're aiming to do a
full set of ten. Just like that. So find a level of resistance. Once you've
mastered stage one and you can do three sets of ten. Move to stage two. Once
you've mastered that, you can move to stage three and that neck is going to be
strong.
